required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pemetrexed Plus Gemcitabine in Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients After Receiving Taxane Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Trial of Alimta (Pemetrexed) and Gemzar (Gemcitabine) in Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients Who Have Received Prior Taxane Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine if the two drugs can help patients feel better while causing the tumor to become smaller or disappear; evaluate the safety of giving both pemetrexed and gemcitabine in patients with advanced breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of (Confirmed) Complete Response or Partial Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated

Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated

Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated

Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated

intervention.description: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days, until disease progression
1500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days, until disease progression
1000 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), on Days 1 and 8 of 21-day cycle, until disease progression
500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days, until disease progression

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have received prior chemotherapy with Taxol (paclitaxel) or Taxotere (docetaxel).
- Less than 3 different chemotherapy treatments for metastatic disease.
- Prior treatment with hormonal and/or radiation therapy.
- Must have disease that can be measured.
- Must be able to take care of self needs for example personal hygiene
Exclusion Criteria:
- Must not be pregnant or breast-feeding.
- Cancer that has spread to the brain.
- Treatment with Gemcitabine or Pemetrexed
- Unable to take folic acid or Vitamin B12
- Treatment for another cancer within the last 5 years

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At completion of the first stage of the trial, toxicities associated with the Day 8 dosing of gemcitabine were observed, and the protocol was amended to a bi-weekly schedule. Patients were analyzed separately according to the study drug schedule received.

group.title: Bi-Weekly Schedule
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days, until disease progression. Gemcitabine: 1500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days, until disease progression.

group.title: 21-Day Schedule
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days, until disease progression. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of a 21-day cycle, until disease progression.

participants_list.participants: Completed for this study means patient received study drug and was eligible for efficacy analysis.
Completed for this study means patient received study drug and was eligible for efficacy analysis.

group.title: 21-Day Schedule
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days, until disease progression. Gemcitabine: 1000 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) on Days 1 and 8 of a 21-day cycle, until disease progression.

measure.title: Karnofsky Performance Status (KPS)
measure.description: The Karnofsky Performance Status Index classifies functional impairment. Scores range from 0 to 100. A higher score means the patient is better able to carry out daily activities.

class.title: <=60 - Needs increasing assistance up to Death (0)
70 - Unable to carry on normal activity
80 - Activity with effort; some signs of disease
90 - Normal activity; minor signs of disease
100 - Normal no complaints; no evidence of disease

measure.title: Time (in months) from Current Pathological Diagnosis to Enrollment

outcome.title: Overall Tumor Response
outcome.description: Best overall (confirmed) response recorded from start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence, start of other anti-tumor therapy/intervention, or end of trial, whichever comes first. Response must be confirmed at least 6 weeks from previous scans. Best overall response assignment depends on both measurement and confirmation criteria.
outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated
outcome.population: Patients who received at least one dose of study drug (pemetrexed or gemcitabine) were included in the analyses.

group.title: Bi-Weekly Schedule
group.description: Pemetrexed: 500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days, until disease progression. Gemcitabine: 1500 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days, until disease progression.

group.title: 21-Day Schedule

measure.title: Overall Tumor Response
measure.description: Best overall (confirmed) response recorded from start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence, start of other anti-tumor therapy/intervention, or end of trial, whichever comes first. Response must be confirmed at least 6 weeks from previous scans. Best overall response assignment depends on both measurement and confirmation criteria.
measure.population: Patients who received at least one dose of study drug (pemetrexed or gemcitabine) were included in the analyses.

outcome.title: Duration of (Confirmed) Complete Response or Partial Response
outcome.description: Duration of response is calculated as (Date of First Disease Progression or Death as a Result of any Cause whichever Comes First - Date of First Objective Status Assessment of Confirmed CR or PR + 1)/(365.25/12).
outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated
outcome.population: Number of patients with a confirmed complete or partial response.

outcome.title: Time to Progressive Disease
outcome.description: Time to progressive disease is calculated as (Date of First Disease Progression or Death Due to Disease under Study whichever Comes First - First Dose Date + 1)/(365.25/12).
outcome.time_frame: Every 6 weeks from start of treatment until documented disease progression or for 6 months from last dose of study drug, whichever occurs first. After 6 months, clinical assessment every 12 weeks and radiologic test performed as clinically indicated

measure.title: Time to Progressive Disease
measure.description: Time to progressive disease is calculated as (Date of First Disease Progression or Death Due to Disease under Study whichever Comes First - First Dose Date + 1)/(365.25/12).

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Time to treatment failure is calculated as (Date of First Disease Progression, Death as a Result of any Cause, or Early Discontinuation of Treatment Due to Adverse Event or Physician Perception of Lack of Efficacy or Patient and Physician Perception of Lack of Efficacy, whichever Comes First - First Dose Date + 1)/ (365.25/12)

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival time is calculated as (Date of Death as a Result of any Cause - First Dose Date + 1)/ (365.25/12).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
